item.title: Stopping null logins on Hyperion
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

tyb97:

Wow, thanks, added, didn’t even know you could have a null login until I read this

There’s probably better ways to do it, but if you just load the client (with the server running) and press “login” without entering a username or password, you would be rejected login but a player would be spawned at the default location.

Read full topic

item.title: Stopping null logins on Hyperion
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

This will stop players from logging in as a blank name (just pressing “login”) and spawning someone at your default spawn point.

RS2LoginDecoder replace World.getWorld().load(pd) with this:

if (name != null && name.length() > 0 && pass != null && name.length() > 0) { World.getWorld().load(pd); } else { PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(); bldr.put((byte) 11); pd.getSession().write(bldr.toPacket()) .addListener(new IoFutureListener<IoFuture>() { @Override public void operationComplete(IoFuture future) { future.getSession().close(false); } }); }

Read full topic
